job_title: Writing Coach in New Orleans, LA
pros:
Amazing, positive, and encouraging atmosphere
Great job while working as a student 
Flexible hours
cons: Offices have no natural light so it can feel dim at times.
Culture totally disconnected from the city
You are permitted to be a grader for a class you're currently taking, which seems strange to me.

pros: flexible and works with class schedule
cons: does not pay enough to cover anything- not bills, rent or tuition

pros:
-You can easily accomplish curricular activities. 
-Great for student part-time job role.
-Great environment of people, making it easy to work there.

job_title: Graphic Designer in New Orleans, LA
pros: The work environment was flexible, relatively low pressure, and easy to deal with. Assignments were not overly difficult, and usually deadlines were easy to meet. Artistic freedom was allowed (although not always approved, see below)
cons: Pay was horrendously low. Most jobs had to meet the scrutiny of faculty that didn't always understand marketing or design standards. Many projects were hampered by expectations and requirements that took away from design.

pros: Caring faculty, family-like environment, academic freedom with some limits, entrepreneurial spirit, expansive set of delivery options
cons: Requires faculty to be a member of an SBC church, family-like atmosphere can be constricting for those not in the inner circle, most professors have degrees from the seminary assuring uniformity of thought, all-white main campus faculty

job_title: Media Assistant in New Orleans, LA
pros: Being a student for free and living on campus for cheap, it allowed me to be involved in making videos while focusing on school and not having to commute far to work, as well as work inbetween classes.
cons: Not nearly enough money to live on; terrible treatment; treated like a "student worker" even though I knew more than my boss about video and saved us from issues countless times. Also it's a seminary so in general people there are too conservative, misogynistic etc.

job_title: Research Associate in New Orleans, LA
pros: encouraging workplace and a great mission
cons: none are really that big of a deal that you wouldn't find at any other sort of school

job_title: Associate Professor in New Orleans, LA
pros: Strong collegiality and concern for the professors.
cons: High pressure work environment with rigorous expectations.

job_title: Staff Assistant in New Orleans, LA
cons: Hourly wage is very low for experienced professional
